details: Morphine bears the same relation to Opium as Atropine to Belladonna - i.e., represents its nervous side. It is less stimulating, less convulsant, and more decidedly hypnotic. Constipates less and affects contractility of the bladder more. It is less diaphoretic and more pruritic.Extreme susceptibility to pain; twitching; tympanites; much itching

Head: Bursting pain; head drawn back
VERTIGO FROM THE LEAST MOVEMENT OF THE HEAD
Headache, with sensation of being wound-up
Stomach: Nausea INCESSANT AND DEATHLY, faintness, constant retching
NAUSEA AND VOMITING ON RISING UP
Abdomen: Acute pain in abdomen and along spinal column
Mouth: Tongue dry, brown violet in middle
Loss of appetite, WITH AVERSION TO MEAT
Rectum: Diarrhoea watery, brown, or black with horrible tenesmus
Constipation; stools large, dry, knotty, with tendency to bruise and fissure
Respiratory: Strangling cough, with viscid mucus sputum; thin, scanty, but sounds loose and abundant
Dry, hard, TEASING, exhausting cough, worse at night
Faint and struggling for breath; DIAPHRAGMATIC PARALYSIS; hiccough; dyspnoea, paroxysmal, on first falling asleep
Eyes: Delusion of vision on closing eyes
Face: DUSKY RED OR PALLID LIVIDITY OF FACE, LIPS, TONGUE, MOUTH OR THROAT
Nose: ITCHING and tingling on end of nose
Ears: Left ear throbs painfully; better, heat
SEEMS TO HEAR CIRCULATION ALL OVER BODY
Heart: Cardiac muscular tissue is intact, even if severely exhausted
Back: Aching across lumbosacral region; cannot walk erect
Sleep: Sleepless; restless sleep, with frequent startings
Skin: Restlessness and hyperaesthesia; trembling, twitching, jerking, convulsions
Pain causes twitching and jerking of limbs
Violent and SUDDEN neuralgic pains and sudden fainting
Neuralgias INTENSELY PAINFUL; left supraorbital; right intercostal, better from heat; MULTIPLE NEURITIS
Throat: Pharynx paralyzed, swallowing almost impossible; better hot drinks, worse solids

name: Morphinum
